AnalystsTest.Text:
5/24/2018 10:56:36 AM
Was the move to demonetize old 500 & 1000 rupees notes a good one? Suggest measures to be taken by the government to fine-tune the digital payment/cashless economy.

 

 Demonetiztion has become a major problem when it was announced by Prime Minister Narender Modi on 8, November 2016.This move has taken because of black money used by politicans,terrorist people , trading of good from one country to another country & other people.When this news was announced some people in country was felt happy and some people felt sad.People who felt happy thought that distribution of black money will be stopped now and corruption will also be stop.People who felt sad i.e., middle class people how would we exchange that 500 & 1000 rupees note.

                People suffered alot when this news announced and they rushed to near by ATM`s centres to deposit & withdrawn money.But ATM`s centres are allowed to give only Rs.2000 per day where banks permitted to give Rs.20,000-Rs.10,000 per week .But some people go in illegal way to get new 500 & 1000 rupees notes from bank managers. They tell them that i will give you commission if you done the work .And for few days all the ATM`s ,banks were closed.People who are not educated for them it is difficult to exchange money.

               And exports & imports of goods from one country to another country was affected because of demonetization.Modi has taken a good step to stop this illegal black money ,funding them to terrorist people & others.We can also stop corruption in this way.Demonetization is affected on some sectors like banking,real estate,food sector & private sector.In business aslo it`s got affected in transaction of money & real estate also came down slow.The step which was taken by Modi is good for some & it was bad .

 

CASHLESS ECONOMY 

Cashless economy plays a  major role in today`s world.When digital payments are came into existence it made  people more comfortable to transact money from anywhere.Digital payments like paytm,phone pay & others .Now-a-days every one are using payitm even in small shops like vegetables , kiran stores etc.But for educated people will be easy but for uneducated it will be diificult for them.

                 Government have  to take measures like security ,cyber crime . For example person will call to you and say that you are selected for a job and he tells you to join in 3-4 days and he will asked you to transfer money like Rs.2,00,000 and he says all the details to whom you have to transfer . Instead of thinking for a while you will transfer the amount and when you will call him he will not lift the call.In a such case government have to ensure that no one will be in that situation and cyber will also have to taken necessary measure to overcome this situation.

                  By introducing these digital payments, most of the people are using online transactions instead of going to the bank and depositing there .It will reduce the time and work but at the same time will not be secure.But if we carry large of cash with travelling it would be difficult for us ,there is a chance of losing or robbery of money .Instead we can just transact the amount from our mobile phone to another phone ,but it should be secure by cyber .Be careful by transacting the amount to other person .

Global Smart Grid Vendor Landscape

 

The  Global smart grid vendor landscape tells about  that hundreds of vendors are working hard to grow in the market.Among 125 countries  the investors of  smart grid which they have invested will be reached to $380.1 billion between 2015 and 2025.500 vendors have actively participated in smart grid projects across the world.In developed countries like North America, Europe , and East Asia,markets are becoming more maturting and vendors are consolidated.Smart grid vendor is undergoing a rapid change in toady`s economy.Meanwhile, large vendors providing smart metering value chain ,data analytics and communications have successfull in multiple smart grid segments and also there is a  rapid change in coordination between smart metering .Distribution automation and home energy management has improved.The growth of  market is becoming popular in the countries like Africa, Central & Eastern Europe, Eurasia, Latin America, the Middle East & North Africa, South Asia, and Southeast Asia.The partners of dozen of local vendors have started their project on their own to serve smart grid projects .In emerging market countries thwy was a high growth in smart grid projects an this represents the vendor activity and opportunity to the next level of frontier.Across the globe,  the fragmented local players are shaping  the speed and direction of smart grid deployments .And their is also a growth in market segments and the partnerships , mergers and acquisitions that are altering the smart grid market.This study tells about how the firms are succeed in shaping the smart grid vendor landscape

 

Brazilian Smart Grid Market – An Insight

 

Brazil is the fifth largest population in the world and also one of the leading emerging market countries in smart grid development.By the end of the decade it will become one of the smart grid markets in the world.With the rapid growth economy ,Brazil is began to strain exist infrastructure. strong underlying market conditions and positive government action are one of the product of Brazil`s smart grid . Through the smart meter deployments Brazil has the highest growth in terms of non-techincal distribution losses and it also provides reap immediate revenue protection benefits.

History:

  • In 2009, Brazilian government has  taken notice that a non-binding target of replacing  all  63  million  existing  electromechanical  meters  with  smart  meters  by  2021. 
  • In 2012, August ,the  government  announced  an  “opt‐in”  smart  meter   regulation  for  existing  customers.New customers, paried with a mandate will require smart meters.
  • In August 2012 ,regulations fell short of the concrete mandate needed for Brazil to meet it’s original goal of 63 million meters by 2021.
  • North east group is forecasting that Brazil will not reach 63 million smart meter target .
  • But the initial goal can be achieved  by government officials and regulators who are optimistic  
  • Market catalyst are expecting to replace all the 63 millions existing legacy  meters  with  smart  meters.

 Significance:

  • Brazil plays a very significant role in smart grid market for both vendors and customers 
  • In the coming decade,Brazil will grow significantly with strong underlying economic and political conditions.
  • Fast deployments will take place easily.
  • By the end of the decade, more than that of Brazilian homes will have smart meters.
  • Customers have to take advantage of advanced smart grid applications to reduce the non-technical losses,new meter installations and smart meters targets.

 

 

 



#################--Don`t Delete below content#################

Global Smart Grid Vendor Landscape

The smart grid vendor landscape is undergoing a period of change. In developed countries in North America, Europe, and East Asia, markets are maturing and vendors are consolidating. Several of the larger vendors now offer integrated solutions throughout the smart metering value chain, while communications and data analytics providers are increasingly active across multiple smart grid segments, improving the coordination between smart metering, distribution automation and home energy management. Meanwhile, in emerging market countries – across Africa, Central & Eastern Europe, Eurasia, Latin America, the Middle East & North Africa, South Asia, and Southeast Asia – the market is just beginning to grow. Dozens of local vendors have begun to serve smart grid projects, both on their own and as partners of larger international firms. With high growth rates projected for smart grid projects in emerging market countries, this represents the next frontier of vendor activity and opportunity. The dynamics between growing and consolidating international smart grid vendors and smaller, more fragmented local players will help shape the speed and direction of smart grid deployments across the globe. This study takes a comprehensive look at the trends shaping the smart grid vendor landscape and how firms are positioning themselves to succeed. It includes over 500 vendors already active in smart grid projects across all regions of the world, highlights growing regions and market segments, and assesses the existing partnerships, mergers, and acquisitions that are altering the smart grid market. Across 125 countries, smart grid investment will reach $380.1 billion between 2015 and 2025. This study presents a picture of the competitive landscape of the hundreds of vendors competing for this growing market.

 

Brazilian Smart Grid Market – An Insight

Brazil is already one of the leading emerging market countries in terms of smart grid development. With the fifth largest population in the world and a government that is eager to modernize the country’s infrastructure, Brazil will become one of the largest smart grid markets in the world by the end of the decade. Brazil’s smart grid development is the product of strong underlying market conditions and positive government action. Like many emerging market countries, Brazil has high rates of non--‐technical distribution losses, implying  that utilities  will  reap immediate revenue protection benefits through smart meter deployments. Brazil also has a rapidly growing economy, which is beginning to strain existing infrastructure. As  the country continues to grow, the reliability and  energy savings benefits of smart grid will become increasingly important. The Brazilian government has  taken notice and in 2009 it  set a non--‐binding target of replacing  all  63  million  existing  electromechanical  meters  with  smart  meters  by  2021. 

However,  in  August    2012, the  government  announced  an  “opt--‐in”  smart  meter   regulation  for  existing  customers,   Paired with  a  mandate  requiring  smart  meters  for  all  new  customers.  This  was  not  the  anticipated  market  catalyst  for    those  expecting  a  binding  mandate  to  replace  all  63  million existing legacy  meters  with  smart  meters.  As  a  result,  Northeast  Group   is  currently forecasting that Brazil will not reach its initial 63 million smart meter target. Yet, some government officials and regulators are still optimistic that the initial goal can be achieved, which may inspire future incentive structures and more favorable smart metering regulations.

With strong underlying economic and political conditions, it is inevitable that Brazil’s smart grid market will grow significantly in the coming decade. The question is simply how fast deployments will take place. Through a combination of new meter installations, smart meters targeted at reducing non--‐ technical losses, and customers eager to take advantage of advanced smart grid applications, more than half of Brazilian homes will have smart meters by the end of the decade. However, the August 2012 regulations fell short of the concrete mandate needed for Brazil to meet it’s original goal of 63 million meters by 2021. Nonetheless, Brazil remains a very significant smart grid market for both vendors and customers alike.
